This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=ACCESSIBUILT.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-10T11:47:46Z Lee Bywater (Tass Ltd) 2015-03-10T11:47:37-00:00 2015-03-10T11:47:37-00:00 Re: Tactile paving at the top of steps / designated accessible WC. https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;3b781cc3.1503 Hi All,<br><br>In Paris we were asked to apply our anti-slip tactile studs internally to<br>the top and bottom of steps in a well-known high street store, they<br>originally wanted the drilled options but being applied to tiles wasn't<br>practical so they went for our adhered version.<br><br>I believe tactile studs are used internally & externally to all stair ways &<br>ramps etc all over the world, I thinks it's only the UK that uses the<br>corduroy trims. I don't know, but will pass your email to Mark (Chair of access group).<br><br>Sandy<br><br>From: Accessibuilt list [mailto:ACCESSIBUILT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Dorothy Wilson<br>Sent: 10 March 2015 08:20<br>To: ACCESSIBUILT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: Suggestions welcome<br><br>If building new properties with a stepped access would need to explain 'why' in the form of an 'Access Statement'; does the site typography prevent level/ramped access to properties?<br>Regards,<br>Dorothy Dorothy Wilson 2015-03-10T08:20:07+00:00 2015-03-10T08:20:07+00:00 Re: Suggestions welcome https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;5f9fb39c.1503 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;5f9fb39c.1503">Re: Suggestions welcome </a> jane Simpson Access 2015-03-09T17:05:10-00:00 2015-03-09T17:05:10-00:00 Re: Suggestions welcome https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;e6f58a23.1503 Most housing developers don\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt use building regulations inspectors or approved inspectors as such, they go to NHBC inspectors. The NHBC has its own guidance standards, which should mirror B Regs, but are signed off differently.<br><br>Regards Jane<br><br>Jane Simpson<br><br>RIBA & NRAC Consultant<br><br>T: 01484 423501<br><br>M: 07777 607239<br><br><http://www.janesimpsonaccess.com/> www.janesimpsonaccess.com<br><br>JaneSimpsonAccessLogo_Black<br><br>Registered address: New House Bungalow, New House Road, Sheepridge, Huddersfield, HD2 1EG Company No 6559802, VAT No 930 0839 42 [...] Dorothy Wilson 2015-03-09T16:31:16+00:00 2015-03-09T16:31:16+00:00 Re: Suggestions welcome https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;5534b028.1503 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;5534b028.1503">Re: Suggestions welcome </a> Hunt, Alan 2015-03-09T16:20:39+00:00 2015-03-09T16:20:39+00:00 Re: Suggestions welcome https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;9cf12ad.1503 If you have received this email in error, please notify us by telephone on 01437 764551 and delete it from your computer immediately. Have a look on the<br>developers website about their NHBC warranty, most offer 10 years.<br><br>Suggest they contact NHBC http://www.nhbc.co.uk.<br><br>Worth a try.<br><br>Jane<br><br>Jane Simpson<br><br>RIBA & NRAC Consultant<br><br>T: 01484 423501<br><br>M: 07777 607239<br><br><http://www.janesimpsonaccess.com/> www.janesimpsonaccess.com<br><br>JaneSimpsonAccessLogo_Black<br><br>Registered address: New House Bungalow, New House Road, Sheepridge,<br>Huddersfield, HD2 1EG Company No 6559802, VAT No 930 0839 42 [...] Bannister, Sandy (CEU) 2015-03-09T16:03:50+00:00 2015-03-09T16:03:50+00:00 Re: Suggestions welcome https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;39d100c1.1503 I think I might get crushed in the stampede of people wanting to join in!<br><br>From: Accessibuilt list [mailto:ACCESSIBUILT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of frews@hotmail.co.uk<br>Sent: 09 March 2015 15:49<br>To: ACCESSIBUILT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: Suggestions welcome<br><br>Sandy,<br><br>I am afraid The answer is disability awareness training that includes practical workshops. But the likelihood of getting them to attend to I can appreciate is very low. I suppose you could always use some rope and a wheelchair, after tying them into the chair ask them to get into the properties. [...] frews@hotmail.co.uk 2015-03-09T15:49:29+00:00 2015-03-09T15:49:29+00:00 Re: Suggestions welcome https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;8b8b6eb4.1503 Sandy,<br><br>I am afraid The answer is disability awareness training that includes practical workshops. But the likelihood of getting them to attend to I can appreciate is very low. I suppose you could always use some rope and a wheelchair, after tying them into the chair ask them to get into the properties. [...] Bannister, Sandy (CEU) 2015-03-09T15:39:24+00:00 2015-03-09T15:39:24+00:00 Suggestions welcome https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;21062100.1503 Hello all. I have been contacted by a local access group which is visiting new developments to check the accessibility of entrances to new homes. In a number of instances they have found stepped thresholds which seem unnecessary. They draw their concerns to the developers' attention but often receive no response. Does anyone have any ideas on how they might challenge more robustly - the properties in question are for general sale. [...] Vin West 2015-03-09T14:38:38+00:00 2015-03-09T14:38:38+00:00 Re: Tactile paving at the top of steps / designated accessible WC. https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;55db53be.1503 this is just soooo wrong in soooo many ways!!<br>judging by the way the wall steps back just visible on the left of the image I would be very surprised if the room size met minimum spec - and what is that grab rail doing on the outside of the door - and the stair hand rail has no turn-downs so will catch sleeves - and there is no second rail at 600mm for shorter people. These sort of situations arise through inclusive access being an afterthought instead of a natural part of the design process.. [...] Brian Seaman 2015-03-09T14:11:22+00:00 2015-03-09T14:11:22+00:00 Re: Tactile paving at the top of steps / designated accessible WC. https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;1390400c.1503 Thanks all for your comments.<br><br>Regards,<br><br>Brian<br><br>Brian Seaman<br>Associate at Access New Business<br>T: 0845 124 9974 / 01293 776225<br>E: brian@accessnewbusiness.co.uk<br>W: www.accessnewbusiness.co.uk<br>Twitter: https://twitter.com/BrianMSeaman<br><br>----- Original Message -----<br>From: jane Simpson Access<br>To: ACCESSIBUILT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Sent: Monday, March 09, 2015 1:04 PM<br>Subject: Re: Tactile paving at the top of steps / designated accessible WC.<br><br>You don't have tactile internally!<br><br>Regards Jane<br><br>Jane Simpson [...] Darryl Smith 2015-03-09T13:20:45+00:00 2015-03-09T13:20:45+00:00 Re: Tactile paving at the top of steps / designated accessible WC. https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;e28dc3e1.1503 Agree with comments.<br><br>Also... Not sure it serves as a tactile surface: It might be my eyes but it looks like there is no raised profile above the floor surface?? jane Simpson Access 2015-03-09T13:04:38-00:00 2015-03-09T13:04:38-00:00 Re: Tactile paving at the top of steps / designated accessible WC. https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;7d890456.1503 You don't have tactile internally!<br><br>Regards Jane<br><br>Jane Simpson<br><br>RIBA & NRAC Consultant<br><br>T: 01484 423501<br><br>M: 07777 607239<br><br><http://www.janesimpsonaccess.com/> www.janesimpsonaccess.com<br><br>JaneSimpsonAccessLogo_Black<br><br>Registered address: New House Bungalow, New House Road, Sheepridge,<br>Huddersfield, HD2 1EG Company No 6559802, VAT No 930 0839 42<br><br>This e-mail is for the addressee only. The information contained in it<br>and any attachments are confidential and may be privileged. If you have<br>received this e-mail in error, please notify us immediately. You are not<br>authorized to, and must not disclose, copy, distribute or retain this<br>e-mail or any part of it. [...] Ormerod Marcus 2015-03-09T12:37:18+00:00 2015-03-09T12:37:18+00:00 Re: Tactile paving at the top of steps / designated accessible WC. https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;899505.1503 Hi Brian<br><br>Ouch!<br><br>The tactile cord surface is not set far enough back from the top step either.<br><br>Regards<br>Marcus<br><br>From: Accessibuilt list [mailto:ACCESSIBUILT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Brian Seaman<br>Sent: 09 March 2015 12:32<br>To: ACCESSIBUILT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: [ACCESSIBUILT] Tactile paving at the top of steps / designated accessible WC.<br><br>[cid:image001.jpg@01D05A65.C775D790]<br>Dear All,<br><br>I thought you might be interested in seeing a clash of ideas at this property. [...] Brian Seaman 2015-03-09T12:31:58+00:00 2015-03-09T12:31:58+00:00 Tactile paving at the top of steps / designated accessible WC. https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;6188d585.1503 Dear All,<br><br>I thought you might be interested in seeing a clash of ideas at this property.<br><br>The designated accessible WC has level access but is situated at the top of two steps (with handrails) leading down to the men's WC facilities. A tactile cord surface has been inlaid to indicate the steps to visitors with a sight loss, but because of the layout this is immediately outside the door to the WC. [...] Darryl Smith 2015-03-09T10:43:37+00:00 2015-03-09T10:43:37+00:00 Inclusive Design- Examples of Good practice https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;b17b3fef.1503 Hi All<br><br>CABE is looking to add to its Inclusive Design Hub by including case studies of built projects or good processes.<br><br>Projects can be any scale (we don't have many small scale), from any country and from any sector. The idea is to showcase good practice which will help the learning of all built environment professionals. Ideally projects must have been recognised in some way (e.g. shortlist for an award) but please don't be shy at this stage! The aim is to include as many as possible and quite often the "less iconic" schemes don't get an opportunity to [...] Francis Lenny 2015-03-06T12:58:17+10:00 2015-03-06T12:58:17+10:00 Re: stair nosings https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;555cb48c.1503 Hi All<br><br>In Australia across the tread is mandated under the Building Code / Access<br>standards<br><br>However, enhanced provisions recommended that it should be on both.which<br>aligns with my own view<br><br>Regards<br>Francis<br><br>On Thu, Mar 5, 2015 at 6:19 PM, Hunt, Alan <Alan.Hunt@pembrokeshire.gov.uk><br>wrote:<br><br>> *If you have received this email in error, please notify us by telephone<br>> on 01437 764551 and delete it from your computer immediately. Os ydych chi<br>> wedi derbyn yr e-bost hwn trwy gamgymeriad, byddwch cystal \ufffd\ufffd rhoi gwybod<br>> inni trwy ffonio 01437 764551. Wedyn dylech ddileu\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdr e-bost ar unwaith oddi<br>> [...] Ryan, Justin 2015-03-05T21:05:43+00:00 2015-03-05T21:05:43+00:00 Re: stair nosings https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;5f48d72d.1503 Hi<br><br>Thanks for everyones replies so far.<br><br>Just to understand why I am asking. It isn't because I wouldn't fit both, they usually come as part of the same antislip tread.<br><br>It is more around the challenges with keeping them visible, whether they are undercover or outside where they are exposed to precipitation. Because of the nature of the antislip of the tread it is very hard to keep clean, whether indoors or out. However the riser is usually smoother and much easier to keep clean - although in the ideal world we would concentrate on getting / keeping both [...] Keith Oakes 2015-03-05T16:28:04+00:00 2015-03-05T16:28:04+00:00 Re: stair nosings https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;1721cc9c.1503 Hi, as a manufacturer of stair nosings, could I ask the person who initiated the question the reasoning for raising it? Thank you Regards Keith Oakes [Gradus Limited]<http://www.gradusworld.com> Keith Oakes - Technical Director Keith.Oakes@gradusworld.com<mailto:Keith.Oakes@gradusworld.com> Head Office: Gradus Limited, Chapel Mill, Park Green, Macclesfield, Cheshire SK11 7LZ England UK Telephone: 01625 428922 www.gradusworld.com<http://www.gradusworld.com> [https://s3.amazonaws.com/htmlsig-assets/grey/twitter.png]<https://twitter.com/Gradus_World> [https://s3.amazonaws.com/htmlsig-assets/grey/flickr.png] <https://www.flickr.com/photos/gradusimagelibrary/> From: Accessibuilt list [mailto:ACCESSIBUILT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Hotmail Sent: 05 March 2015 16:08 To: ACCESSIBUILT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK Subject: Re: stair nosings I agree that we should target both too. I fear that if we start a dialogue about which is most essential we imply that one can [...] Hotmail 2015-03-05T16:07:55+00:00 2015-03-05T16:07:55+00:00 Re: stair nosings https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;be02054e.1503 I agree that we should target both too. I fear that if we start a dialogue about which is most essential we imply that one can be sacrificed.<br><br>From experience I have to say that the riser is important as risers are more likely to be uneven than the treads and present a trip hazard. [...] jane Simpson Access 2015-03-05T08:59:56+00:00 2015-03-05T08:59:56+00:00 Re: stair nosings https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;e7baa10b.1503 Agree Alan it should be on both and if you catch the design early enough definition should be possible on both. However trying to achieve the ADM version externally can be problematic. I would be interested in photos of examples for when the BS8300 is reviewed to look at possible approaches. [...] Hunt, Alan 2015-03-05T08:19:41+00:00 2015-03-05T08:19:41+00:00 Re: stair nosings https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;be86699f.1503 If you have received this email in error, please notify us by telephone on 01437 764551 and delete it from your computer immediately. Os ydych chi wedi derbyn yr e-bost hwn trwy gamgymeriad, byddwch cystal \ufffd\ufffd rhoi gwybod inni trwy ffonio 01437 764551. Wedyn dylech ddileu\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdr e-bost ar unwaith oddi ar eich cyfrifiadur. [...] Vin West 2015-03-04T18:50:11+00:00 2015-03-04T18:50:11+00:00 Re: stair nosings https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;5b0f2ef7.1503 Tread / Riser: 70/30<br><br>Vin West<br>Chair<br>Arfon Access Group<br>01286880761<br>07771536760<br>Glyn Dwr<br>Llandwrog Uchaf<br>Caernarfon<br>LL54 7RA<br>vin.west99@btinternet.com<br><br>> On 4 Mar 2015, at 15:40, jane Simpson Access <jane@JANESIMPSONACCESS.COM> wrote:<br>><br>> Prefer both but if only one definitely tread. Falling down is more dangerous than falling up!<br>><br>> I know it can be a problem particularly outside.<br>><br>> Regards Jane<br>><br>> Jane Simpson<br>> Sent from my iPhone<br>><br>> On 4 Mar 2015, at 15:31, Ryan, Justin <Justin.Ryan@SOUTHEASTERNRAILWAY.CO.UK <mailto:Justin.Ryan@SOUTHEASTERNRAILWAY.CO.UK>> wrote:<br>><br>>> Dear All<br>>><br>>> Can people give me their thoughts on [...] Darryl Smith 2015-03-04T16:58:36+00:00 2015-03-04T16:58:36+00:00 Re: stair nosings https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;76a23fb7.1503 Both equally important I would say,<br><br>Tread most visible coming down stairs but not always depending upon angle of approach and volume of traffic.<br>Riser most visible approaching bottom of stairs (ditto above).<br><br>I don't think I would ever advise the one without the other.<br><br>Hope this helps rather than hinders discussion..? Tina Lowe 2015-03-04T16:36:55-00:00 2015-03-04T16:36:55-00:00 Re: stair nosings https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;76a0755c.1503 Hi<br><br>As a blind person with a tiny amount of residual vision with light/dark<br>colour contrast I would say that the tread is better.<br><br>It is more visible and much more useful if it is tactile under foot.<br><br>Thanks.<br><br>All the best.<br><br>Tina Lowe, Campus Accessibility Officer, University college Dublin.<br><br>From: Accessibuilt list [mailto:ACCESSIBUILT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of<br>Ryan, Justin<br>Sent: 04 March 2015 15:31<br>To: ACCESSIBUILT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: stair nosings [...] Brian Seaman 2015-03-04T16:01:15+00:00 2015-03-04T16:01:15+00:00 Re: stair nosings https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;bb16d089.1503 I'd go with the tread as being the most useful, but would definitely support highlighting of the riser as well.<br><br>For what it's worth, in my opinion, together they aid more users in either direction on a flight of steps.<br><br>Thanks,<br><br>Brian<br><br>Brian Seaman<br>Associate at Access New Business<br>T: 0845 124 9974 / 01293 776225<br>E: brian@accessnewbusiness.co.uk<br>W: www.accessnewbusiness.co.uk<br>Twitter: https://twitter.com/BrianMSeaman [...] Redmond, Judy 2015-03-04T15:43:47+00:00 2015-03-04T15:43:47+00:00 Re: stair nosings https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;c5fe70d8.1503 People with low vision in Canada tell us \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdless is better\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. When you give them too much in the way of markings they become meaningless.<br><br>Judy Redmond, MSc. Accessibility and Inclusive Design<br>Universal Design Coordinator<br>City of Winnipeg<br>204-986-2131<br><br>This e-mail message (including attachments, if any) is intended for the use of the individual or entity to which it is addressed and may contain information that is privileged, proprietary, and confidential. If you are not the intended recipient, you are notified that any dissemination, distribution, or copy of this communication is strictly prohibited. If you have received this communication in [...] jane Simpson Access 2015-03-04T15:40:33+00:00 2015-03-04T15:40:33+00:00 Re: stair nosings https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;38c30160.1503 Prefer both but if only one definitely tread. Falling down is more dangerous than falling up!<br><br>I know it can be a problem particularly outside.<br><br>Regards Jane<br><br>Jane Simpson<br>Sent from my iPhone<br><br>> On 4 Mar 2015, at 15:31, Ryan, Justin <Justin.Ryan@SOUTHEASTERNRAILWAY.CO.UK> wrote:<br>><br>> Dear All<br>><br>> Can people give me their thoughts on the usefulness of stair nosings highlighted on the tread as opposed to the riser?<br>><br>> I.e. I am sure , in the ideal world it is best for both to be highlighted equally, but as we don\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt live in the ideal world, [...] Ryan, Justin 2015-03-04T15:31:25+00:00 2015-03-04T15:31:25+00:00 stair nosings https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;12e70c52.1503 Dear All<br><br>Can people give me their thoughts on the usefulness of stair nosings highlighted on the tread as opposed to the riser?<br><br>I.e. I am sure , in the ideal world it is best for both to be highlighted equally, but as we don't live in the ideal world, and say it could only be either on the tread or the riser, not both, what would be most useful? [...] Redmond, Judy 2015-03-04T15:02:47+00:00 2015-03-04T15:02:47+00:00 Transportation vehicles https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACCESSIBUILT;203a2b8b.1503 Good morning,<br><br>Does anyone have any good documents that provide a checklist for what to look at with respect to ergonomics and meeting the principles of universal design in motorized vehicles like fork lifts, front end loaders, transit buses etc.?<br><br>Judy Redmond, MSc. Accessibility and Inclusive Design<br>Universal Design Coordinator<br>City of Winnipeg<br>204-986-2131<br><br>This e-mail message (including attachments, if any) is intended for the use of the individual or entity to which it is addressed and may contain information that is privileged, proprietary, and confidential.
